divs: sighting detailsi went outside to let my dog go to the bathroom and looked up into the sky for no real reason. i only noticed the object\objects because i'm a retired air force flyer and always look up to see any air traffic in the area. i can tell by the traffic if there's been a wind change at the airport requiring airplanes to use a different approach to the field. there was no wind. the object looked like two pale amber lights that appeared to be subdued by some sort of haze or fog. but the sky was absolutely clear in every direction. there was no street noise where i was standing but the object was completely silent. it appeared to be only about 150 yards from me at the most. it also appeared to be no higher than 500 feet agl, which would be an faa violation for any aircraft in this area. if the craft was further away from me or higher than i thought then it was moving at an even more incredible speed and was much larger. either the two lights were on the same craft or they were in perfect formation. and they were exactly the same size. they did not blink. the object was moving towards the southeast at an extreme rate of speed. i should've been able to hear something at that range if it were a normal aircraft. as it passed my position it faded rapidly as if becoming somehow invisible. my reaction to seeing this was a complete loss of situational awareness. i had no idea what my dog was doing and just kept staring up even after this thing had disappeared, holding on to her leash. i must've stared up at nothing for a full 5 minutes, which is pretty long just to stare at nothing. when i returned to my apartment my hands were shaking and my palms were sweating. that thing just shouldn't have been there, and shouldn't have displayed those flight characteristics. i guess it was shaking my reality a little bit. it almost looked like it was semi-transparent, or enveloped in a fog or haze that moved with it. i almost hate to make this reference, but the way it disappeared looked exactly the way a romulan ship looks when it's cloaking itself on star trek. i should have been able to continue to observe this thing as it flew away, but it just faded out. it didn't just wink out...it faded out.
Summary: Two fast-moving, silent, low amber lights heading southeast over Pittsfield.
